circumstances: Shortly after takeoff from Barrow Airport, while in initial climb, the right engine failed. The pilot lost control of the airplane that stalled and crashed in flames. A passenger was seriously injured while seven other occupants were killed.
probable_cause:
The accident was probably caused by the combination of the following factors:
- Failure of the right engine for undetermined reason, 
- Improper operation of flight controls, 
- Improper operation of powerplant, 
- Improper emergency procedures, 
- Inadequate preflight preparation, 
- Improperly loaded aircraft-weight and CofG, 
- Aircraft allowed to enter condition of asymmetrical thrust, 
- Aircraft overloaded by 475 lbs.
